Package it.polimi.ingsw.model

Class IslandsManager

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.IslandsManager
public class IslandsManager extends Object
IslandManager contains all the information about islands and mother nature.

      public IslandsManager()

  • Method Details

    • islandsInitialize

      public void islandsInitialize()
      Initialize islands using miniBag, an arrayList filled with two students per color. Mother position is extracted randomly.

    • setIslandsSizeAfterRestore

      public void setIslandsSizeAfterRestore(int size)
      Restore the right number of islands.
      Parameters:
      size - is the size of the saved ArrayList.

    • restoreIslands

      public void restoreIslands(int islandRef, int[] students, int towerValue, Team towerTeam, int inhibited)
      Restore all the components on island.
      Parameters:
      islandRef - the islands reference;
      students - array of students which were on the island;
      towerValue - number of towers which were on the island;
      towerTeam - Team who owned the island;
      inhibited - number of no entry tiles which were on island.

    • restoreMotherPose

      public void restoreMotherPose(int islandRef)
      Restore the position of mother nature.
      Parameters:
      islandRef - the islands reference.

    • getIslandsSize

      public int getIslandsSize()

    • incStudent

      public void incStudent(int island, int color, int studentOfThisColor)
      Increase the number of students on the island.
      Parameters:
      island - the islands reference;
      color - the color reference;
      studentOfThisColor - number of students.

    • towerChange

      public int[] towerChange(int islandRef, Team team)
      Change the tower team on the island.
      Parameters:
      islandRef - the islands reference;
      team - new team owner
      Returns:
      array with in the first cell the number of towers built, in the second the previous owner of the towers

    • checkVictory

      public boolean checkVictory()
      Game is over if there are just 3 island or less.
      Returns:
      true if islands are 3 or less.

    • circularArray

      public int circularArray(int pos, int number)
      Sum to the number of island a number to not get out of the array.
      Parameters:
      pos - the islands reference;
      number - the number to sum;
      Returns:
      the result of the sum.
